member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.Authorize.AuthorizeNetRecurringManager.ProcessRequest(Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.Authorize.ANetApiRequest)
member.summary: Send the request to the API server and load the response into an XML document. An XmlSerializer is used to form the XML used in the request to the API server. The response from the server is also XML. An XmlReader is used to process the response stream from the API server so that it can be loaded into an XmlDocument.
member.returns: Object containing the response received from the API server.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.Authorize.AuthorizeNetRecurringManager.DeserializeResponse(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Deserialize the given XML document into the correct object type using the root node to determine the type of output object. For any given API request the response can be one of two types: ErorrResponse or [methodname]Response. For example, the ARBCreateSubscriptionRequest would normally result in a response of ARBCreateSubscriptionResponse. This is also the name of the root node of the response. This name can be used to deserialize the response into local objects.
member.param: This is the XML document to process. It holds the response from the API server.
member.returns: True if successful, false if not.

member.name: M:Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.Authorize.AuthorizeNetRecurringManager.ThrowIfResultIsError(Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.Authorize.ANetApiResponse)
member.summary: Determine the type of the response object and process accordingly. Since this is just sample code the only processing being done here is to write a few bits of information to the console window.

member.summary: Fill in the merchant authentication. This data is required for all API methods.

member.name: T:Mediachase.Commerce.Plugins.Payment.GenericPaymentGateway
member.summary: Generic Payment Gateway should be used in the place of gateways that do no provide real time credit card charges. For instance pay by phone, pay by fax, invoice or gateways that redirect to the gateway website, like PayPal.

member.summary: Charges the order, no recurrence pattern is checked.
member.param: The message passed back, most often an error if transaction failed.
member.returns: True if process successfully; otherwise False.
